title: JAM / COALITION WARSHIP ARCHER -- SOONA VERSION
description: CUTSCENE where you attempt to contact Coalition Warship Archer with SOONA. PART OF THE MORALIST DREAM QUEST

dialogueTree.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And now if you'll just connect tha..."
dialogueTree.text: "And now if you'll just connect that here..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's done. I believe we're ready."..."
links.text: "It's done. I believe we're ready." The lieutenant wipes his brow.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We're ready to try, at least. Plea..."
links.text: "We're ready to try, at least. Please, put on these headphones, there should be two extra sets. I've configured the channels so that only your microphone is set to broadcast, officer. We'll all be able to listen, but anyone we reach will only hear *your* voice."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You will need to transmit your con..."
links.text: "You will need to transmit your connection request while I attempt to locate the warship's public frequency. You will likely encounter some interference, but it's important to keep transmitting your request until you're acknowledged. Ready?"

links.title: You: ""Wait, what if they *never* acknowl..."
links.text: "Wait, what if they *never* acknowledge me?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then it will be exactly like every..."
links.text: "Then it will be exactly like every other moment of every other day. I ask again: Are you ready?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Good. Beginning transmission.""
links.text: "Good. Beginning transmission."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Shivers: "A soft rustling. The snow seems to..."
links.text: A soft rustling. The snow seems to have gotten between your ears somehow...

links.title: You: "Where's the sound coming from?"
links.text: Where's the sound coming from?

links.title: Shivers: "Every lightswitch, every motor carr..."
links.text: Every lightswitch, every motor carriage, every doorbell, tea kettle, and radio in Martinaise, all mingled with electrical interference caused by scattered thunderstorms over Ozonne.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Officer? Are you in order? We're w..."
links.text: "Officer? Are you in order? We're waiting for you to start..."

links.title: You: "Ignore it."
links.text: Ignore it.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Go ahead, officer.""
links.text: "Go ahead, officer."

links.title: You: ""What should I say?""
links.text: "What should I say?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We don't have time for indecision...."
links.text: "We don't have time for indecision. Just say whatever first comes to mind."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is RCM Officer Firewalker. Please acknowledge."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Inland Empire: "You're all alone out there, wanderi..."
links.text: You're all alone out there, wandering a blasted heath, calling out to the night, but there is no reply, except for the buzzing of invisible machines...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up at you with..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks up at you with a nervous glance.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He is nervous for your sake, of cou..."
links.text: He is nervous for your sake, of course, but also his own.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Looking at him now, with both hands..."
links.text: Looking at him now, with both hands on his headphones, you see very briefly what the lieutenant must have been like when he first joined the RCM...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Then he turns to you. He gives you..."
links.text: Then he turns to you. He gives you a half smile along with an almost imperceptible nod of encouragement.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Then he turns to you. His expressio..."
links.text: Then he turns to you. His expression seems to say, 'You'd better not leave this mess for me alone'.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Then he turns to you. He shakes his..."
links.text: Then he turns to you. He shakes his head slightly and looks back at the amplifier.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Nervous for who, though, you cannot..."
links.text: Nervous for who, though, you cannot say.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Try again, officer.""
links.text: "Try again, officer."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Firewalker. Please acknowledge."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Perception (Hearing): "Perhaps you're simply imagining it,..."
links.text: Perhaps you're simply imagining it, but it seems as though you're learning to pull apart the fibres of this auditory felt. You focus on one strand in particular, one that sounds very nearly human...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Nein, Liebling! Das lasse ich nich..."
links.text: "Nein, Liebling! Das lasse ich nicht zu … Wie kannst du unseren Jungen bloß auf einem dieser *Dinger* nach Vredefort schicken?"

links.title: You: ""Hello... Archer? Do you acknowledg..."
links.text: "Hello... Archer? Do you acknowledge?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Marianne ... mir erzählt, dass Osk..."
links.text: "Marianne ... mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr ... seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ... halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal ... aber sie hat das Gefühl ... seit seiner Rückkehr ... einem Fremden zusammenzuleben..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Something about her son going to Vr..."
links.text: Something about her son going to Vredefort on an aerostatic... to see some psychologists? Or maybe it's the psychologists saying it's normal... to have feelings for strangers? Foreign languages were never your strong suit.

links.title: You: "What does this remind me of?"
links.text: What does this remind me of?

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The rustling of dry autumn leaves...."
links.text: The rustling of dry autumn leaves. Waves breaking at a distance. A thousand wings beating at once.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's just like that woman in the el..."
links.text: It's just like that woman in the electronic doorbell... the circuit ghost...

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's strangely comforting to think..."
links.text: It's strangely comforting to think of these voices travelling through the air, until you capture them, firefly-like, with your little metal antenna...

links.title: You: ""Soona, is this more of that entrop..."
links.text: "Soona, is this more of that entroponetic crosstalk?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's very likely, based on what we..."
links.text: "It's very likely, based on what we've recently learned. Give me a moment while I attempt to narrow the receiving mode..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""In the meantime, you must keep try..."
links.text: "In the meantime, you must keep trying."

links.title: You: ""Soona, I think there are ghosts in..."
links.text: "Soona, I think there are ghosts in this radio."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Not ghosts, officer. Crosstalk. Yo..."
links.text: "Not ghosts, officer. Crosstalk. You have to keep trying until we get a signal through."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Firewalker. If you're there, Archer, please acknowledge."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Soona, the Programmer: ""Again.""
links.text: "Again."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Firewalker. Do you acknowledge?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's cold now...""
links.text: "It's cold now..."

links.title: Shivers: "A slight frisson at the point where..."
links.text: A slight frisson at the point where your neck meets your spine. Something about the lieutenant's words, directed at you, but not *you*.

links.title: You: ""Kim, don't clog my connection.""
links.text: "Kim, don't clog my connection."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I didn't say anything, detective.""
links.text: "I didn't say anything, detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...someone has been maintaining it..."
links.text: "...someone has been maintaining it. The wiring has been repaired..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "An uncomfortable silence falls over..."
links.text: An uncomfortable silence falls over the connection.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... It's been a long winter... Lon..."
links.text: "... It's been a long winter... Long and cold..."

links.title: You: ""Are you going to tell me you didn'..."
links.text: "Are you going to tell me you didn't say *that*, either?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I promise you, I didn't, even thou..."
links.text: "I promise you, I didn't, even though it certainly *sounds* like me..." The lieutenant seems to wince at the sound of his own voice.

links.title: You: ""Could this be more entroponetic cr..."
links.text: "Could this be more entroponetic crosstalk?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes," the programmer cuts in. "A p..."
links.text: "Yes," the programmer cuts in. "A particularly eerie specimen, but still just a harmless piece of the past returning to surface."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. I just wish I could remembe..."
links.text: "Right. I just wish I could remember what I was talking about..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Something here is eating at the lie..."
links.text: Something here is eating at the lieutenant, as much as he would like to move past it.

links.title: You: ""What is happening?""
links.text: "What is happening?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I can't say with certainty, but it..."
links.text: "I can't say with certainty, but it *sounds* very much like entroponetic crosstalk. It happens sometimes when sending transmissions across long stretches of pale."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes, of course. That must be i..."
links.text: "Ah, yes, of course. That must be it..."

links.title: Composure: "Outwardly, they both exude calm, bu..."
links.text: Outwardly, they both exude calm, but there's something disturbing about this thought to both of them.

links.title: You: ""Maybe it's your twin brother?""
links.text: "Maybe it's your twin brother?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can assure you, it's not my 'twi..."
links.text: "I can assure you, it's not my 'twin brother'. Though it certainly does *sound* like me..." The lieutenant seems to wince at the sound of his own voice.

links.title: You: ""What are you talking about, Kim? I..."
links.text: "What are you talking about, Kim? It's perfectly nice out."

links.title: You: ""It's really coming down, now that..."
links.text: "It's really coming down, now that you mention it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mention what?""
links.text: "Mention what?"

links.title: You: ""It's cold, like you just said.""
links.text: "It's cold, like you just said."

links.title: Shivers: "A slight frisson at the point where..."
links.text: A slight frisson at the point where your neck meets your spine. You can *feel* the lieutenant's presence, even though he's nowhere to be found...

links.title: You: ""Kim? How did you get on my connect..."
links.text: "Kim? How did you get on my connection?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There's no way the lieutenant has..."
links.text: "There's no way the lieutenant has his *own* mega-low frequency connection. Very strange..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Kim Kitsuragi: ""...someone has been maintaining it..."
links.text: "...someone has been maintaining it. The wiring has been repaired..."

links.title: You: ""What is he talking about?""
links.text: "What is he talking about?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I believe you mean, what *was* he..."
links.text: "I believe you mean, what *was* he talking about."

links.title: You: ""Are you saying this is more entrop..."
links.text: "Are you saying this is more entroponetic crosstalk, then?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, that's by far the most likely..."
links.text: "Yes, that's by far the most likely explanation. But the odds of us hearing him, though, out of all the voices in the pale..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's been a long winter... Long an..."
links.text: "It's been a long winter... Long and cold."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""...are astronomically low.""
links.text: "...are astronomically low."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Natürlich halten ihn die Psycholog..."
links.text: "Natürlich halten ihn die Psychologen für vollkommen normal..."

links.title: You: ""Roy said this transceiver came wit..."
links.text: "Roy said this transceiver came with some kind of *signal purifier*. Maybe we should turn that on?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah! Very good thinking. I'll engag..."
links.text: "Ah! Very good thinking. I'll engage it now..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... someone has been maintaining i..."
links.text: "... someone has been maintaining it..." The lieutenant's voice suddenly grows faint and distant, as though he were speaking from a passing motor carriage...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's much better. Please, try ag..."
links.text: "That's much better. Please, try again."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer. Do you a..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer. Do you acknowledge? This is Firewalker."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Horseback Antenna: ""... Warship Archer. Are you there,..."
links.text: "... Warship Archer. Are you there, Firewalker? Please acknowledge."

links.title: You: ""Archer! This is Firewalker. Can yo..."
links.text: "Archer! This is Firewalker. Can you hear me?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Soona, the Programmer: ""Damn..." The programmer removes he..."
links.text: "Damn..." The programmer removes her sweat-drenched headphones. "Even with the crosstalk suppressed the signal is still very weak."

links.title: You: ""What can we do?""
links.text: "What can we do?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I did not expect simply locating t..."
links.text: "I did not expect simply locating the signal to be so difficult." She appears to be concentrating very intently.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We must consider several variables..."
links.text: "We must consider several variables: local entroponetic conditions, the sophistication of our transceiver, the quality of our connections, and the physics of our antenna itself."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Fortunately, we have a more-than-a..."
links.text: "Fortunately, we have a more-than-adequate transceiver, so I do not believe it is causing any problems..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And we're also unlikely to change..."
links.text: "And we're also unlikely to change our local entroponetic conditions. So the next step is to thoroughly inspect our connections."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Our transceiver is perfectly capab..."
links.text: "Our transceiver is perfectly capable, so there is no problem there..."

links.title: You: ""How am I supposed to inspect the c..."
links.text: "How am I supposed to inspect the connections?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You need to climb up there and loo..."
links.text: "You need to climb up there and look at them for yourself." She stares at you as though it were obvious. Her hand gestures to the colourful cables dangling from the horse's forehooves.

links.title: Logic: "But you don't have the technical ex..."
links.text: But you don't have the technical expertise...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... someone has been maintaining i..."
links.text: "... someone has been maintaining it..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No problem at all. You've already t..."
links.text: No problem at all. You've already teleported up *way* greater heights.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Come on, son. This isn't anything b..."
links.text: Come on, son. This isn't anything but a common high bar! Just get a solid overhand grip and hoist yourself up!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Images of your body smashed against..."
links.text: Images of your body smashed against the pavement flood your mind -- this is *dangerous*.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Something about this set-up seems d..."
links.text: Something about this set-up seems dimly familiar, but you'll be damned if you know what you're supposed to do about it.

links.title: You: ""But I don't know what I'm doing...""
links.text: "But I don't know what I'm doing..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's true, but I can't leave my..."
links.text: "That's true, but I can't leave my station, so it will have to be you."

links.title: You: ""No problem. I've already mastered..."
links.text: "No problem. I've already mastered the art of teleportation."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You actually haven't. But you have..."
links.text: "You actually haven't. But you have proven that you're a relatively capable climber."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Teleportation isn't real. Climbing..."
links.text: "Teleportation isn't real. Climbing is, however. With all its hazards."

links.title: You: ""But what if I slip and fall...""
links.text: "But what if I slip and fall..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then you might break your neck," s..."
links.text: "Then you might break your neck," she replies matter-of-factly.

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's do this." (Climb the m..."
links.text: "Okay, let's do this." (Climb the monument.)

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Your gloves give you a solid grip o..."
links.text: Your gloves give you a solid grip on the metal bar. This feels pleasingly familiar...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Keep it together, champ! You've *go..."
links.text: Keep it together, champ! You've *got* this.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "... and before you know it, you're..."
links.text: ... and before you know it, you're safely perched atop the monument.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The metal bar is cold and slick wit..."
links.text: The metal bar is cold and slick with precipitation. For a moment it feels as though you're about to slip, but you concentrate all your attention on your pectoral muscles and squeeze...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Don't forget the lats, champ! You'v..."
links.text: Don't forget the lats, champ! You've *got* this.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The cold metal chills your bare han..."
links.text: The cold metal chills your bare hands. Some part of your brain tells you something is missing...

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and..."
links.text: Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and keeps your grip firm.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "... but before you can decide what,..."
links.text: ... but before you can decide what, you find yourself safely perched atop the monument.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The cold metal chills your bare han..."
links.text: The cold metal chills your bare hands. Some part of your brain tells you something is missing...

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and..."
links.text: Chalk powder. Absorbs moisture and keeps your grip firm.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You don't exactly cut a lithesome f..."
links.text: You don't exactly cut a lithesome figure, but after several moments of scrambling you manage to hoist yourself atop the monument.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "That performance was, frankly, an e..."
links.text: That performance was, frankly, an embarrassment.

links.title: You: ""Did you *see* that bar work?""
links.text: "Did you *see* that bar work?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, you're a natural gymnast, det..."
links.text: "Yes, you're a natural gymnast, detective. Now would you like to do what you got up there to do?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I didn't see anything. I was focus..."
links.text: "I didn't see anything. I was focussed on my work. Have you checked the connections yet, or no?"

links.title: You: ""That was pretty bad. I hope nobody..."
links.text: "That was pretty bad. I hope nobody saw it."

links.title: You: "Examine the connections."
links.text: Examine the connections.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The connection itself is nothing mo..."
links.text: The connection itself is nothing more than a little braid of exposed wire wrapped about the hoof of the horse, a copper fetter it cannot slip.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The whole monument is covered in a..."
links.text: The whole monument is covered in a thin but durable layer of oil and grime. It's obvious no one has cleaned it in years.

links.title: Logic: "The programmer mentioned ammonia, b..."
links.text: The programmer mentioned ammonia, but anything *alcoholic* should dissolve the oils, creating a cleaner (and clearer) connection.

links.title: You: "Pour some alcohol over the connecti..."
links.text: Pour some alcohol over the connections.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "It takes a few moments, but the alc..."
links.text: It takes a few moments, but the alcohol gradually begins to break down the oils surrounding the copper wiring.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is this really the time, detective?""
links.text: "Is this really the time, detective?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's alright, lieutenant. He's sim..."
links.text: "It's alright, lieutenant. He's simply cleaning the connections."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What are you doing?! Oh... cleanin..."
links.text: "What are you doing?! Oh... cleaning the connections? Smart."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "More than that, you're sacrificing..."
links.text: More than that, you're sacrificing something precious on the altar...

links.title: You: "Clean the connections with the ammo..."
links.text: Clean the connections with the ammonia.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Almost immediately, the ammonia beg..."
links.text: Almost immediately, the ammonia begins breaking down the oils around the copper wiring.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Glad that stuff came in handy afte..."
links.text: "Glad that stuff came in handy after all..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah. Very good, officer.""
links.text: "Ah. Very good, officer."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Once the oils have been dissolved,..."
links.text: Once the oils have been dissolved, you wipe off the connections with your sleeve and reattach the cable.

links.title: You: ""Did that help?""
links.text: "Did that help?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Hmm, I had hoped that between the..."
links.text: "Hmm, I had hoped that between the signal purifier and cleaning the connections that we would have it, but perhaps I overestimated."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... unser einziges Kind. Er kann d..."
links.text: "... unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Hmm, it seems to have made some di..."
links.text: "Hmm, it seems to have made some difference, but unfortunately not enough to alter the overall situation."

links.title: Logic: "If you had something *alcoholic*, y..."
links.text: If you had something *alcoholic*, you could dissolve the oils, creating a cleaner (and clearer) connection.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Truth be told, you have no idea wha..."
links.text: Truth be told, you have no idea what you're looking for. It just looks like a cord attached to a piece of metal. You pick at the colourful rubber jacketing, not sure what else to do...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Well, do you see anything?""
links.text: "Well, do you see anything?"

links.title: You: ""The whole statue's covered in weir..."
links.text: "The whole statue's covered in weird oils. I don't think it's good for the connections."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Damn, I was afraid of that. And I..."
links.text: "Damn, I was afraid of that. And I didn't bring any solvents with me. How foolish..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Short of changing the shape of the..."
links.text: "Short of changing the shape of the antenna, I'm not sure what else we can do from here. And the lorries are all jammed together, so that's unlikely to happen."

links.title: You: ""What would changing the shape of t..."
links.text: "What would changing the shape of the antenna do?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ideally, narrow the receiving mode..."
links.text: "Ideally, narrow the receiving mode, so that we can isolate the warship's signal and eliminate the crosstalk. But if you don't know what you're doing of course you could just make it worse."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She sighs. "I'm afraid we're out of..."
links.text: She sighs. "I'm afraid we're out of alternatives. You're just going to have to *go for it*."

links.title: Empathy: "She's right. The responsibility is..."
links.text: She's right. The responsibility is yours and yours alone. There's no turning back now.

links.title: You: "Look at the rider."
links.text: Look at the rider.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You are face to face with Filippe I..."
links.text: You are face to face with Filippe III. The bronze king looks toward the west. Something about his features seems bizarrely distorted.

links.title: Logic: "Not intentionally. It’s a matter of..."
links.text: Not intentionally. It’s a matter of perspective. The king was never meant to be seen from such an angle as you’ve attained.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "His imperious gaze leads you natura..."
links.text: His imperious gaze leads you naturally to his outstretched hand, which for some reason strikes you as sadly empty...

links.title: Endurance: "He seems ill-equipped for wherever..."
links.text: He seems ill-equipped for wherever he’s going. A king should not go about unarmed.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You can't help but feel that *sabre..."
links.text: You can't help but feel that *sabre* you picked up might just give this old king a little more panache *and* better reception!

links.title: Conceptualization: "Come on! Kings and sabres are so *p..."
links.text: Come on! Kings and sabres are so *played out*. There's a *better* way...

links.title: You: "Wait, what's this "better way"?"
links.text: Wait, what's this "better way"?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Why not arm the good king's valiant..."
links.text: Why not arm the good king's valiant steed instead? There seems to be *just* enough room between its teeth there...

links.title: You: "That's brilliant! [Put the sabre be..."
links.text: That's brilliant! [Put the sabre between the horse's teeth.]

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "To your surprise, the sabre slides..."
links.text: To your surprise, the sabre slides snugly between the horse's bared teeth.

links.title: You: "That's a little *too* out there. [P..."
links.text: That's a little *too* out there. [Put the sabre in the king's hand.]

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: You: "Attach the sabre."
links.text: Attach the sabre.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "To your surprise, the sabre's hilt..."
links.text: To your surprise, the sabre's hilt fits quite snugly in the statue's hand. The king cuts quite the triumphal figure now.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There is no way *that* is going to..."
links.text: "There is no way *that* is going to make any difference..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's making a very *slight* differ..."
links.text: "It's making a very *slight* difference. The signal is a bit clearer than it was."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Huh. The signal is coming through..."
links.text: "Huh. The signal is coming through a bit clearer now. Good work."

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The king won't know what he's missi..."
links.text: The king won't know what he's missing. He stares straight ahead, his expression defiant and verdigris.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective? Yo..."
links.text: "Everything in order, detective? You're really giving Filippe III a stare."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Are you alright, officer?""
links.text: "Are you alright, officer?"

links.title: You: "Look at the horse."
links.text: Look at the horse.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "This faithful steed cuts a dashing..."
links.text: This faithful steed cuts a dashing figure with the replica sabre between its teeth.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "This faithful steed is in nearly as..."
links.text: This faithful steed is in nearly as poor a condition as its rider.

links.title: You: "Look up."
links.text: Look up.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A clear sky. The kind of day where..."
links.text: A clear sky. The kind of day where anything might happen...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Across the river, you can see Coali..."
links.text: Across the river, you can see Coalition Warship Archer tracing its gradual circuit above Revachol East.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The sky is gray and overcast. Someh..."
links.text: The sky is gray and overcast. Somehow, the raindrops seem to fall more slowly from this angle...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Through the scrim, you can just mak..."
links.text: Through the scrim, you can just make out the shadow of Coalition Warship Archer a few kilometres to the east.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A clear night sky. The stars make f..."
links.text: A clear night sky. The stars make for a brilliant display...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "Across the river, you can see the l..."
links.text: Across the river, you can see the lights of Coalition Warship Archer floating above Revachol East.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The sky is opaque with dark clouds...."
links.text: The sky is opaque with dark clouds. Somehow, the raindrops seem to fall more slowly from this angle...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You turn to the east, but the visib..."
links.text: You turn to the east, but the visibility is quite poor. You see no sign of Coalition Warship Archer, though you know it can't be too far away.

links.title: You: "Look down."
links.text: Look down.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A few of the idle lorry drivers and..."
links.text: A few of the idle lorry drivers and strike breakers gesture at you with their cigarettes, more out of curiosity than anything else. From the window of one of the adjacent apartment buildings, an older woman leans out, her heavy breasts sagging...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "She yells a single word you can't m..."
links.text: She yells a single word you can't make out, and then shuts the window with a violent *thunk*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Down below a little doll-sized lieu..."
links.text: Down below a little doll-sized lieutenant is looking up, shielding his eyes. He's worried for you.

links.title: You: "Attempt to narrow the receiving mod..."
links.text: Attempt to narrow the receiving mode manually.

links.title: Interfacing: "Your grip is firm, yet controlled...."
links.text: Your grip is firm, yet controlled. The swelling in your headset guides your hands as much as your hands guide the bronze horse head. It's almost like you're hearing *through* the horse itself...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's very good. Just a bit more..."
links.text: "That's very good. Just a bit more to the left..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... Nein, Liebling!""
links.text: "... Nein, Liebling!"

links.title: Interfacing: "The signal is clear, the storm has..."
links.text: The signal is clear, the storm has passed. This is another voice, a live voice, on the other end of this invisible bridge you've established...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Try it now, officer.""
links.text: "Try it now, officer."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer. This is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer. This is RCM Officer Firewalker. Please acknowledge."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, this is Coalition Wars..."
links.text: "Firewalker, this is Coalition Warship Archer. We are acknowledging and accepting you."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Aha, excellent! You are connected...."
links.text: "Aha, excellent! You are connected. Now be quick, I don't know how long I'll be able to preserve the signal."

links.title: Authority: "This is it... you're finally gettin..."
links.text: This is it... you're finally getting to speak with those who hold *real* power.

links.title: Rhetoric: "And by that, they mean the ones wit..."
links.text: And by that, they mean the ones with the guns and the warships...

links.title: Empathy: "There is so much you wish you could..."
links.text: There is so much you wish you could ask. Your efforts have bought you some time, but you can't forget what you're *really* here for...

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Please be advised that you are spe..."
links.text: "Please be advised that you are speaking on the public frequency. What is your request?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's been a long winter... Long an..."
links.text: "It's been a long winter... Long and cold."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "A loud sigh comes through the headp..."
links.text: A loud sigh comes through the headphones. "Be advised, officer. The signal is liable to fail any moment now..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""... Firewalker? Are you there?""
links.text: "... Firewalker? Are you there?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Officer, I've held the signal open..."
links.text: "Officer, I've held the signal open as long as I can. Whatever you came here to ask, ask it now."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Is everything alright?""
links.text: "Is everything alright?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte... Er ist unser ei..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte... Er ist unser einziges Kind..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Time is running short, officer. I..."
links.text: "Time is running short, officer. I estimate you have time for *maybe* two more questions..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Come again? We are picking up more..."
links.text: "Come again? We are picking up more interference..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's been a long winter... Long an..."
links.text: "It's been a long winter... Long and cold."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "A loud sigh comes through the headp..."
links.text: A loud sigh comes through the headphones. "Be advised, officer. The signal is liable to fail any moment now..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""... Firewalker? Are you there?""
links.text: "... Firewalker? Are you there?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm not joking, officer. I'll only..."
links.text: "I'm not joking, officer. I'll only be able to hold the signal open for a few more moments. What you came here to ask, ask it now..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Is everything alright?""
links.text: "Is everything alright?"

links.title: Empathy: "There is so much you wish you could..."
links.text: There is so much you wish you could ask, but you probably only have time for one or two questions before the signal is lost...

links.title: Interfacing: "You allow the broken hunk of metal..."
links.text: You allow the broken hunk of metal to clatter to the ground. It wasn't clear to you it did anything anyway...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Nein, Liebling!""
links.text: "Nein, Liebling!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What are you doing? The connection..."
links.text: "What are you doing? The connection is even worse now! This is extremely unprofessional."

links.title: You: ""That piece of junk didn't even wor..."
links.text: "That piece of junk didn't even work!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That is because you broke it. Thin..."
links.text: "That is because you broke it. Things stop working when you break them. Or did you not know that?"

links.title: Empathy: "She's right. This was your responsi..."
links.text: She's right. This was your responsibility...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Damn it! I'm going to push the pow..."
links.text: "Damn it! I'm going to push the power supply. I doubt it will last more than a few minutes, so you'd better make them count."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A maelstrom of sound, swirling and..."
links.text: A maelstrom of sound, swirling and swirling around an invisible point. It's mounting, mounting...

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... nicht mehr derselbe ist, seit..."
links.text: "... nicht mehr derselbe ist, seit er auf einem Luftschiff aus Graad zurückgekommen ist..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... Firewalker? Please respond...""
links.text: "... Firewalker? Please respond..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It's too much! Your ear drums are t..."
links.text: It's too much! Your ear drums are throbbing, about to burst!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... a long winter... Long and cold..."
links.text: "... a long winter... Long and cold..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "... and then, nothing."
links.text: ... and then, nothing.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Try it now.""
links.text: "Try it now."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer. This is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer. This is RCM Officer Firewalker. Please acknowledge."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Coalition Warship Archer: ""This is... Warship Archer. We are..."
links.text: "This is... Warship Archer. We are acknowledging and accepting you... though we're still getting quite a bit of interference..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""This is the best we can do. I sugg..."
links.text: "This is the best we can do. I suggest you get to your business quickly. I doubt I'll be able to maintain even *this* connection very long."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry! I was trying to do good.""
links.text: "I'm sorry! I was trying to do good."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But you didn't, you made things wo..."
links.text: "But you didn't, you made things worse."

links.title: You: ""It's not *my* fault the statue bro..."
links.text: "It's not *my* fault the statue broke."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But it *is*, because *you* broke i..."
links.text: "But it *is*, because *you* broke it."

links.title: Interfacing: "You allow the broken hunk of metal..."
links.text: You allow the broken hunk of metal to clatter to the ground. It wasn't clear to you it did anything anyway...

links.title: You: ""How do we change the shape of the..."
links.text: "How do we change the shape of the antenna?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What do you mean? You adjust the a..."
links.text: "What do you mean? You adjust the antenna, manually, with your hands."

links.title: You: ""The connections are pretty dirty,..."
links.text: "The connections are pretty dirty, but I don't have anything to clean them with."

links.title: You: ""The connections look fine to me.""
links.text: "The connections look fine to me."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I sincerely doubt that's the case,..."
links.text: "I sincerely doubt that's the case, but there's nothing I can do about it from down here. I should've cleaned them beforehand. How foolish..."

links.title: You: ""Maybe we should try again later?""
links.text: "Maybe we should try again later?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There won't *be* any later. This i..."
links.text: "There won't *be* any later. This is our chance. Now please, keep going."

links.title: You: "(Sigh.) "Coalition Warship Archer...."
links.text: (Sigh.) "Coalition Warship Archer. Do you acknowledge? This is Firewalker."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But someone has been maintaining i..."
links.text: "But someone has been maintaining it. The wiring has been repaired..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Horseback Antenna: ""... Walker? Please acknowledge.""
links.text: "... Walker? Please acknowledge."

links.title: You: ""Archer! This is Firewalker. Can yo..."
links.text: "Archer! This is Firewalker. Can you hear me?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""... Warship Archer. Please identif..."
links.text: "... Warship Archer. Please identify."

links.title: Interfacing: "The signals are getting increasingl..."
links.text: The signals are getting increasingly mixed. Plucking Archer's signal from this will be like isolating a single strand from a tangle of hair.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's not working." The programmer..."
links.text: "It's not working." The programmer removes her sweat-drenched headphones. "The crosstalk is simply too strong."

links.title: You: ""So what can we do about it?""
links.text: "So what can we do about it?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What else is there to do? Keep try..."
links.text: "What else is there to do? Keep trying."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what are *you* talking about?""
links.text: "Wait, what are *you* talking about?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's been a long winter... Long an..."
links.text: "It's been a long winter... Long and cold."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It sounds very much like entropone..."
links.text: "It sounds very much like entroponetic crosstalk. It happens sometimes when sending transmissions across long stretches of pale..."

links.title: Composure: "Outwardly, she exudes calm, but the..."
links.text: Outwardly, she exudes calm, but there's something disturbing about this thought to her.

links.title: Logic: "Hold on, isn't the pale supposed to..."
links.text: Hold on, isn't the pale supposed to be thousands of kilometres from here?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Here it is again, this pale... If o..."
links.text: Here it is again, this pale... If only you knew more about it.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Pale? Pale-pale-pale... Seems to be..."
links.text: Pale? Pale-pale-pale... Seems to be missing from your records.

links.title: You: ""I can't understand a word of this..."
links.text: "I can't understand a word of this gibberish."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It isn't gibberish, it's Walder. N..."
links.text: "It isn't gibberish, it's Walder. Now please, keep trying."

links.title: You: ""What's going on?""
links.text: "What's going on?"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's crosstalk. In all likelihood..."
links.text: "It's crosstalk. In all likelihood they can't hear you. You have to keep trying until we get a signal through."

links.title: You: "Keep listening."
links.text: Keep listening.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einz..."
links.text: "Liebling, bitte… Er ist unser einziges Kind. Er kann doch auch nächstes Jahr zur Akademie gehen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Keep trying, officer. We'll get a..."
links.text: "Keep trying, officer. We'll get a signal through eventually."

links.title: Rhetoric: "You can't make out a word of this g..."
links.text: You can't make out a word of this gibberish.

links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Nein, Liebling! ... unseren Jungen..."
links.text: "Nein, Liebling! ... unseren Jungen... nach Vredefort ... einem dieser *Dinger*..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "I-i-is there anybody th-th-there?"
links.text: I-i-is there anybody th-th-there?

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is RCM Officer Tequila Sunset. Please acknowledge."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Detective Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau of the RCM. Please acknowledge."

links.title: You: ""Coalition Warship Archer, this is..."
links.text: "Coalition Warship Archer, this is Lieutenant Harrier du Bois of the RCM. Please acknowledge."

links.title: Shivers: "A soft rustling. Between your ears,..."
links.text: A soft rustling. Between your ears, a winterscape with fast falling snow...

links.title: You: ""Not yet.""
links.text: "Not yet."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Too late. I've begun transmitting...."
links.text: "Too late. I've begun transmitting..."

links.title: You: ""Got it. Are we ready?""
links.text: "Got it. Are we ready?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We're ready to try, at least. Plea..."
links.text: "We're ready to try, at least. Please, put those on. I've configured the channels so that only your microphone is set to broadcast. We'll both be able to listen, but anyone we reach will only hear *your* voice."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You will need to transmit your con..."
links.text: "You will need to transmit your connection request while I attempt to locate the warship's public frequency. You will likely encounter some interference, but it's important to keep transmitting your request until you're acknowledged. Ready?"
